p: Docking score clearly indicated that chlorobenzoyl esters 13– 15 had binding energy with both the CYP51A1 (–7.9 to –12.0 kcal/mol; Figure 7(a,b)) and 1R51 (–7.5 to –9.3 kcal/mol; Figure 7(c,d)) proteins which were higher than the standard antibiotic ampicillin (–7.9 and –7.5 kcal/mol). The results are in complete accord with the in vitro results ( Table 5) that these uridine esters had better antifungal activities.
